Message.Title: When will split occur?
Message.Msg: Anyone buying the October options? Isn't the split supposed to occur in October? If so, anyone know how the options will be affected?

Basically, when a stock splits, the OCC or Options Clearing Corporation, automatically adjusts your options holding through your your broker to reflect the proportion of the split such that you too will end up with a net position value which is equivalent to before the split. For example, if you presently own one Oct. ‘12 GOOG $740 strike price call option valued at $19.50 per contract on the day of a 2-for-1 split, you will end up with two Oct. ’12 GOOG $370 strike price call options valued at $9.75 each.

Topic.Title: Watch out, Vringo bites the big dog Google

Message.Msg: While analysts have speculated on what kind of damages Vringo (VRNG) is seeking in its patent suit against Google (GOOG), AOL and others, the company finally came out with a partial number to answer that question ahead of its Oct 16 trial date. In recently filed court paperwork, it estimates $696M in past damages--a figure that doesn't include past interest or any future royalties, and dwarfs the company's market cap of about $188M. Investment banking firm Maxim Group last month estimated the total potential windfall at around $924M. Shares up 1c at $3.25. (END) Dow Jones Newswires September 21, 2012 12:33 ET (16:33 GMT)

Topic.Title: Vringo -vs Google: Google's (defendent) MOTION to Dismiss all Claims [293]

Message.Msg: These are normal pre-trial motions Motion In Limine, to limit scope of evidence or anything that atty's don't want mentioned at trial. The pre-trial motions are intended to limit disruptions during the course of the trial. I googled up a definition for you, WHAT IS A MOTION IN LIMINE? A motion in limine is a motion “at the threshold” of trial to exclude evidence deemed inadmissible and unfairly prejudicial by the party bringing the motion. [FMC Corp. v. Plaisted & Cos. (1998) 61 Cal.App.4th 1132.] The purpose of a motion in limine is to prevent the jury from hearing matters which are prejudicial, objectionable, irrelevant, or inadmissible. A motion in limine is brought to “avoid the obviously futile attempt to ‘unring the bell’” once highly prejudicial evidence is offered and then stricken at trial.

Message.Title: FBI, DOJ should INVESTIGATE Yaho admin activities regarding pulling articles AGAINST VRNG shareholders???
Message.Msg: FBI, DOJ should INVESTIGATE Yaho admin activities regarding pulling articles AGAINST VRNG shareholders??? Interestingly enough not long ago, Yahoo pulled one-article bashing Vringo from MF four times on VRNG yahoo messages board, three of them at 10 am in a few minutes interval, SCARING VRNG shareholders of Google "win" but that article did not show up on Google or AOL yahoo messages borads. Again, yahoo pulled another MF article on AOL yahoo messages SCARING AOL sharerholders from VRNG WIN but that did not show up on VRNG yahoo messages board until a day or two later but that also did not show up on Google yahoo messages board
